summary: AMD beat estimates on top and bottom lines in its first-quarter earnings report . The chipmaker signed a $10 billion deal with a Saudi Arabian artificial intelligence start-up . AMD finished the month up 14%, according to data from S&P Global Market Intelligence .  AMD reported 36% revenue growth to $7.44 billion, well ahead of the consensus . Data center revenue jumped 57% to $3.7 billion, driven by strong growth of EPYC CPU chips . The client segment, which serves the PC market, was strong as well, with revenue up 68% .  AMD announced a deal with Humain, a Saudi Arabian AI-start-up, to deploy 500 megawatts of AI computer capacity over the next five years . The company doesn't have to catch Nvidia to be successful in AI, as there as plenty of spillover demand, as well as companies looking for cheaper options . AMD also announced a $6 billionshare repurchaseauthorization .  Stock Advisor’s total average return is994% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to172% for the S&P 500 . Cloud computing firm CoreWeave reported record-breaking performance results using Nvidia's latest Grace Blackwell chips . Firm ran 2,496 GB200 GPUs on its AI-focused cloud platform to complete industry's largest-ever MLPerf Training v5.0 submission . Performance gains are critical for speeding up AI development cycles .  The company brought the GB200 GPUs online in April, following its public listing in March . It was the first cloud provider to offer them broadly at scale .

On June 3rd, Citi analyst Atif Malik reiterated a Buy rating on NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) with a $180.00 price target . The analysts have pointed out Nvidia’s strategic focus on artificial intelligence (AI) networking . This growth has led to 86.17% year-over-year revenue growth and 70.11% gross profit margin .  NVLink solutions have grossed over $1 billion in sales . Spectrum-X (Ethernet) portfolio has achieved two new customers, contributing to a quarterly run-rate of $2 billion . NVLink is a scale-up platform connecting 72 GPUs and benefits larger language models .  NVIDIA specializes in AI-driven solutions, offering platforms for data centers, self-driving cars, robotics, and cloud services . The company has been in the spotlight for more than a decade .

CoreWeave rallied in May off of the April "liberation day" bottom . The company held its first earnings release, beating expectations and raising guidance . Nvidia disclosed that it raised its investment in the company .  Shortly after the rollback of China tariffs, CoreWeave also held its first-ever earnings release . While investors had something of a mixed reaction to earnings, most Wall Street analysts raised their price targets afterward . Just days later, it was revealed that AI chip darling Nvidia had increased its investment in the company .  CoreWeave has a 15-year, $7 billion data center expansion agreement with data center operatorApplied Digital . Given the massive spike in the stock price, there's a degree of meme stock momentum right now . Investors should be careful with the stock at this valuation . AMD acquires AI software optimization startup Brium . Terms of the deal were not disclosed . AMD says it's committed to "building a high-performance, open AI software ecosystem"  Brium is AMD's fourth strategic acquisition in the past two years . It's meant to help AMD overcome one of its biggest roadblocks: a large percentage of AI software is being designed for Nvidia hardware .  AMD has acquired several companies including Nix.AI and Mipsology . The company is set to be acquired by the end of the next year .

NVIDIA recently unveiled Ada and SPARK programming languages in collaboration with AdaCore, targeting the automotive market . NVIDIA's stock price rose by 28%, reflecting a broader trend in the market which experienced a 13% rise over a year .  NVIDIA's total shareholder return, incorporating both share price and dividends, surged by a large percentage over a five-year period . This long-term performance puts NVIDIA well above its recent one-year return, which exceeded the broader US market's 12.6% rise . Despite this impressive growth, the current share price of US$113.54 remains below the consensus analyst price target . For the fifth year in a row, Fortunepartnered with Indiggoto publish the ROL100® a unique ranking that captures the ReturnOnLeadership® of the top 100 companies in the Fortune 500 . Wedbush Fund Advisers launches the Dan IVES Wedbush AI Revolution ETF . The fund will trade on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol IVES . It tracks 30 companies handpicked from Ives's "AI Revolution Theme"  IVES debuts within a saturated market, with roughly 4,000 ETFs available in the US alone . The fund will be available to both institutional and retail investors . Holdings include major AI players like Nvidia, Microsoft, and defense-focused firms like Palantir .  Dan Ives told Yahoo Finance, "There is only one that encompasses my investing team and the research that investors have trusted me to deliver" focus on the AI theme or employ AI-driven strategies .

The number of chips required to train large language models is dropping dramatically . MLCommons, a nonprofit group that publishes benchmark performance results for AI systems, released new data about chips from Nvidia and others .  Nvidia's Blackwell chips are more than twice as fast as previous generation of Hopper chips, data shows . Nvidia and its partners were the only entrants that submitted data about training that large model . In the fastest results for Nvidia's new chips, 2,496 Blackwell chips completed training test in 27 minutes .  "Using a methodology like that, they're able to continue to accelerate or reduce the time to train some of these crazy, multi-trillion parameter model sizes," Kapoor said . tasks, rather than creating homogenous groups of 100,000 chips or more . tasks .

Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) soared 2.8% on Tuesday to reclaim its perch as the world's most valuable company . The surge reflects insatiable demand for AI hardware: Nvidia's GPUs remain indispensable for data centers and generative AI workloads, driving revenues sharply higher over the past two years .  Nvidia's ability to sustain margins and expand its AI?accelerator leadeven amid export restrictions is what continues to fuel its sky?high valuation . of $45.92 billion before accounting for the China GPU ban .

Palantir Technologies closed at a record for a third consecutive day Tuesday, pushing their gain for the year to 76% . Shares of the data-analysis software company close at record for the third straight day Tuesday . While that’s good enough for second-best on the S&P 500 Index, it has a staggering 205 times projected earnings over the next 12 months . That's a hefty premium to the broader market's 22 times .  Palantir’s cult-like momentum rally stands in sharp contrast to a lukewarm reception from Wall Street analysts . The stock has only eight buy equivalent ratings and is dominated by 16 holds, with six sells, making it one of the lowest rated S&P 500 stocks .  Palantir forecasts sales will rise to $3.9 billion for the calendar year 2025, a 36% increase from the previous year . This year’s free cash flow is forecast to top $1.5 billion, a more than 30% increase on the year .  Palantir was the third most active in the last week behind Tesla and Nvidia . The company has continued to land government contracts during the Trump administration . Wall Street analysts think the current rally has gotten ahead of itself .  Palantir has an increasingly high bar to clear to keep the stock grinding higher . Anything short of outperformance could weigh on shares, as was seen in the brief selloff following last quarter’s earnings report . CrowdStrike Holdings Inc. shares fell after the cybersecurity company projected revenue for the current quarter that trailed estimates .  Manus unveiled a text-to-video generation feature, entering a competitive segment populated by rivals from OpenAI to China’s Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. and Tencent Holdings Ltd. NVIDIA is the world's most valuable company, boasting a market capitalization of $3.45 trillion . Since bottoming at just over $94 in early April, NVIDIA stock has soared nearly 50%, adding over $1 trillion in market cap in less than two months . That rally was supercharged by robust first-quarter earnings, continued strength in AI chip demand and expansion plans .  Data Center revenues jumped 73% year over year to $39.1 billion . Demand for NVIDIA’s AI chips, especially for large cloud providers and AI supercomputing, continues to surge . NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang said, "Countries around the world are recognizing AI as essential infrastructure"  NVIDIA is back in positive territory for the year, gaining 5% . CEO Jensen Huang revealed the company is considering the development of a new AI chip designed specifically for the Chinese market .  Analysts remain optimistic about the chipmaker’s growth prospects . The stock is currently trading at a PEG ratio of 1.15, much lower than the industry average of 2.18 . James van Geelen has nailed some of the biggest transformational mega themes of the past decade . He spotted the opportunity to invest in weight-loss drugs in 2023 before they exploded in 2024 . He was an early AI mover, which he spied as a game changer in 2022, early 2023 .  Van Geelen started macro and thematic equity research group Citrini Research in 2023 and manages Citrinitas Capital Management . He believes the growth is already occurring in industrials like Amazon . The e-commerce giant works with privately held robot supplier Agility Robotics .  Van Geelen: "Our favorite kind of theme is where you can buy a secular story — something that will play out over the next 10 years at a cyclical price" Most companies with exposure to humanoid robots are exposed to the automotive market, he said .  Van Geelen: Technology will eventually mean a robot does our dishes and laundry . He said the consumer is probably going to be renting it, which will spawn companies that provide those as a service . He also has advice for retail investors .  Nvidia's DeepSeek was released because they saw a potential threat to the AI chipmaker’s dominance . “The era of robotics is now. That was good enough for me to buy it [Nvidia] back.”  Private sector payrolls from ADP rose just 37,000 in May versus expectations for 110,000, the smallest rise in two years . Institute for Supply Management’s services index is due at 10 a.m. Atlanta Fed Pres. Raphael Bostic and Fed Gov. Lisa Cook will appear at an event .  Dollar Tree beat forecasts, but shares of the discount retailer are falling after it said second-quarter results will take a tariff hit . CrowdStrike stock CRWD is dropping after the cybersecurity company disappointed Wall Street with current quarter outlook . Guidewire Software stock GWRE is up 11% after the insurance-software provider raised its outlook . Wells Fargo stock WFC is getting a lift after the Fed lifted the bank’s asset cap, after years of restrictions over its fake-accounts scandal .  The dollar is in a “multi-decade strengthening cycle,” says Robin Brooks, senior fellow at the Brookings Institution . Brooks blames equity flows from investors who bought into U.S. exceptionalism that are now reversing .  Retail investors are getting bolder just when the risks are getting bigger, say analysts . Robinhood and these other stocks could join the index .

CoreWeave shares have roughly tripled in value over the last month . The AI cloud provider announced an agreement to lease data center space from Applied Digital earlier this week . The companies, both backed by AI giant Nvidia, signed a pair of 15-year deals to lease the space at Applied Digital's North Dakota facility for about $7 billion .  CoreWeave shares were up 1% in early trading Wednesday to $153.57 ending Tuesday's session over $150.57 on Tuesday's trading day . CoreWeaves shares were also up by 1% on Wednesday morning .

Two and a half years into the AI boom and things are still progressing at a torrid pace . Nvidia(NVDA),Vertiv(VRT) andVistra(VST) represent some of the most compelling and diversified exposure to the theme .  Nvidia remains the single most important company in the AI infrastructure buildout . Shares currently trade at 32.4x forward earnings, well below the company’s 10-year median . Despite its dominant market position, Nvidia's valuation remains relatively attractive .  Vistra stands to be one of the biggest beneficiaries of the AI-driven surge in electricity demand . The company trades at 28.3x forward earnings, with analysts forecasting a 34.6% jump in earnings over the next year .  VST has shown relentless strength since bottoming in April, climbing steadily with minimal pullbacks . On Tuesday, the stock jumped higher following news that Meta Platforms signed a 20-year agreement with Constellation Energy to purchase nuclear power . The stock is now approaching all-time highs and continues to show strong momentum .  Vertiv currently trades at 30.8x forward earnings, with analysts projecting impressive annual earnings growth of 27.2% over the next three to five years . VRT has been in a strong uptrend since its April lows, with multiple bullish consolidations and breakouts along the way .  Nvidia, Vistra, and Vertiv each represent a different yet complementary piece of that ecosystem . All three are showing strong momentum, robust earnings growth, and valuations that remain reasonable . For investors looking to ride the next leg of the AI boom, these stocks offer compelling, diversified exposure .

And the second, third derivative beneficiaries of tech are just starting to focus on AI." The ETF will trade under the aptly-named ticker, IVES . Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang plans to sell up to 6 million shares worth roughly $810 million by the end of 2025 . Huang's sale was set up in March and is part of a scheduled program that allows executives to sell stock without violating insider trading rules . Huang still owns over 922 million shares, more than 3.7% of Nvidia, remains one of the chip giant's biggest shareholders . Shares in the chipmaker climbed about 3% to $141.40, lifting its market capitalization to roughly $3.45 trillion . Nvidia's recent gains follow strong fiscal first-quarter results last week . Nvidia beat expectations in its 2026 fiscal first quarter . CEO Jensen Huang sees a massive long-term opportunity as generative AI becomes an integral part of societal functioning . Nvidia stock has gained more than 24,000% over the past 10 years .  Sales increased 69% year over year in the first quarter, beating analyst expectations . Non-GAAP gross margin was 61% instead of 71.3%, and EPS would have been $0.96 . Huang says he sees generative AI becoming a basic element of human life . Huang is worried that shutting the U.S. out of China gives China incentive to develop its own AI technology .  To turn $10,000 into $1 million, Nvidia stock would need to increase a hundredfold, or 10,000% . Nvidia has $148 billion in trailing 12-month sales . Last year, revenue increased 114%, but it's already slowing down .  Imagine that sales grow at a compound annual growth rate of 30% over the next 10 years, sales would reach $1.8 trillion . It's more likely that as the base grows, the rate will slow . That doesn't mean you shouldn't invest in Nvidia today, but keep your expectations in check . Nvidia edged out Microsoft in market cap on Tuesday, ending the day with a market value of $3.444 trillion . Nvidia, Microsoft, and Apple have been jostling to occupy the spot as the world’s most valuable company for nearly a year .  Nvidia’s market cap is still below its record of $3.66 trillion from earlier January when sharesset their all-time high . Qualcomm CEO Cristiano Amon says Apple's licensing agreement with Qualcomm ends in 2027 . The tech giant is transitioning to its own in-house C1 modem in a bid to boost margins . Research firm Futurum estimates that Qualcomm's annual modem revenue from Apple is between $5.7 and $6.7 .  Qualcomm has said publicly it expects to have a 70% share in iPhones launching this fall . That will drop to 20% for iPhones next fall, then stand to be zero for iPhones debuting in 2027 . To offset the lost Apple sales, Qualcomm continues to invest in the connected car cockpit and internet of things domain .  Qualcomm plans to launch processors designed for data centers to power artificial intelligence . The Street has taken a wait-and-see approach to Qualcomm's stock, preferring to witness tangible progress in diversifying its business .  Qualcomm's stock has been trading at a price-to-earnings ratio discount to the S&P 500 for the past three years . The current P/E multiple is roughly a 39% discount . Shares are down 28% in the past year compared to a 13% advance for the S.P 500 . The stock also trades at a more than 20% discount versus its 20-year median P.E. Warren Buffett owns nearly $2 billion of a well-known AI stock . Most investors fail to realize the company's long-term potential . Amazon actually gets most of its profits from its cloud business .  Nearly every AI application requires cloud infrastructure to train and deploy the models necessary to function . Amazon's Amazon Web Services division is the primary contributor of Amazon's profitability . AWS contributes less than 20% of total sales, but is a primary contributor to Amazon's profits .  Amazon's scale gives it durable competitive advantages across the board, especially when it comes to cost, reach, and sourcing high-demand, low-supply chips . Worldwide spending on AI is expected to reach $632 billion by 2028, growing at a rate of 29% annually .  80% to 90% of data center GPUs use Nvidia's products . Amazon has a competitive advantage due to scale, while Nvidia's position is mostly due to technological superiority and software lock-in . Amazon's position, meanwhile, may actually strengthen over time due to compounding scale advantages .  Amazon won't generate magnificent returns, but growth in AWS makes the stock a long-term buy . Amazon has the potential to overtake Nvidia in the years to come . The Motley Fool Stock Advisor’s total average return is987% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to171% for the S&P 500 . Nvidia reported another outstanding quarterly report despite geopolitical headwinds . The artificial intelligence (AI) leader will continue to profit from the next phase of AI expansion . AI factories are using Nvidia's software to make its hardware more efficient for enterprises .  Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang called it out in the company's recent fiscal 2026 first-quarter report . The first stage of the AI wave has been adding massive amounts of computing power to build and train models . Nvidia's sales exploded fourfold in its data center segment in just the last two years .  Nvidia is now leading the global development of AI factories . They host the full life cycle of AI from data input, training, tweaking, and calibrating . The result gives enterprises the ability to enable prediction, generate content, and perform reasoning to seek solutions .  Nvidia realized a massive amount of success over the last several years as AI technology entered the mainstream with chatbots . It is partnering with Saudi Arabia's state-owned AI company Humain to build AI factories that will utilize hundreds of thousands of Nvidia's most advanced GPUs .  Investors owning Nvidia stock now should have a solid chance of beating the market for years to come . Nvidia has many more products to continue growing revenue as AI expands across virtually every sector .  Nvidia's Rebound From the Correction Will Continue to Beat the Market, says Howard Smith . The Motley Fool has invested in Nvidia and other tech companies .

Meta Platforms is generating strong growth as its AI capabilities boost advertising revenue . The company delivered an impressive Q1, helping to brush aside market concerns about a shifting economy . The stock's several advantages relative to its "Magnificent Seven" peers may help it outperform in the second half of 2025 .  Meta Platforms distinguishes itself through pioneering innovation in social media, with over 3.4 billion monthly active users across its ecosystem, including Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp . Unlike hyperscalers likeMicrosoftandAmazon, whose AI strategies depend on selling cloud-based AI services to external clients, Meta's strength lies in directly applying its AI models to enhance its core advertising business .  In the first quarter of 2025, revenue rose 16% year over year . Net income soared 35% to a record $16.6 billion, or $6.43 in earnings per share . Despite higher AI investment, Meta generated $10.3 billion in free cash flow . Wall Street analysts anticipate 14% revenue growth for 2025 and 2026 .  Meta Platforms stands out as a top AI stock because of its attractive valuation . With a forward price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 25, Meta trades at a large discount to its Magnificent Seven peers .  Meta Platforms stock is a great option for investors seeking to build a diversified portfolio with exposure to high-level themes in technology and AI . While internet giantAlphabetis the exception, trading at a forward P/E of 18, it faces significant regulatory scrutiny . Quantum computing has emerged as one of the hottest areas in the artificial intelligence (AI) realm . IonQ, Rigetti, and D-Wave Quantum all have momentum fueling their share prices . But valuation trends suggest that these stocks may be in a bubble . History suggests that a precipitous sell-off could be in store for emerging companies fueling the quantum computing opportunity .  AI has become a megatrend fueling the stock market to new highs over the last couple of years . Semiconductors, cloud computing, and enterprise software seem to fetch the most enthusiasm . The gains in the Defiance Quantum exchange-traded fund areIonQ(NYSE: IONQ) and Rigetti Computing(NASDAQ: RGTI)  Quantum computing has emerged as a potential "next big thing" in the AI landscape . Despite little commercial scale, the total addressable market for quantum computing is expected to be in the hundreds of billions of dollars . But considering how game-changing quantum computing might be for the AI movement, shouldn't investors look past these valuation multiples?  IonQ, Rigetti, and D-Wave Quantum are only generating tens of millions in revenue while burning hundreds of millions of dollars annually . As businesses mature and diversify their products and services, they (hopefully) achieve a path to consistent profitability and begin to be valued based on earnings and cash flow .  IonQ, Rigetti, and D-Wave Quantum could see extreme levels of compression in valuation multiples . Ultimately, I think the quantum computing stocks I've talked about here are speculative . They're geared more for day traders and less appealing for investors with a long-run horizon . Hewlett Packard Enterprise beat Wall Street's second-quarter revenue and profit estimates . Shares of the server-maker rose 5% in premarket trading on Wednesday .
